DOC.brief_summary: The study test hypothesis correction vitamin D deficiency among woman PCOS improve insulin sensitivity resistance inflammatory response PCOS .
DOC.brief_title: Vitamin D Status Relation Insulin Sensitivity Among Saudi Women With Polycystic Ovary Syndrome
DOC.detailed_description: Polycystic ovary syndrome ( PCOS ) common complex heterogenous endocrine disorder . It affect â‰¤10 % woman reproductive age , approximately 16 % -80 % affected woman obese . Polycystic ovary syndrome frequently associate insulin resistance ( IR ) accompany compensatory hyperinsulinemia , IR aggravate interaction obesity syndrome . Moreover , contribution body mass and/or body fat distribution IR PCOS remain controversial . In addition , woman PCOS IR increase risk develop diabetes , hypertension , dyslipidemia atherosclerosis . Preliminary data local woman PCOS show high prevalence vitamin D deficiency ( serum 25 ( OH ) D < 50 nmol/L ) . Recent study show vitamin D deficiency link IR , type 2 diabetes mellitus , obesity , inflammation cardio vascular disease . Several study demonstrate serum 25 ( OH ) D level negatively correlate body mass index ( BMI ) , body fat , IR . These condition common among woman PCOS . Accordingly , anticipate vitamin D deficiency and/or insufficiency may contribute endocrine metabolic disarrangement among woman PCOS . Such adverse effect may contribute risk long term complication among woman PCOS .
DOC.criteria: PCOS diagnosis include three Rotterdam criterion pregnancy lactation take vitamin calcium supplement excess regular multivitamin diabetes mellitus uncontrolled hypertension liver disease renal disease secondary cause hyperandrogenism metabolic bone disease thyroid dysfunction take oral contraceptive take hypoglycemic agent ( metformin thiazolidinediones ) medication affect plasma sex steroid > /3 month study smoker
